{{Infobox national youth basketball team |country=Spain |country_alt=U-19 |color1=AA151B |color2=F1BF00 |joined_fiba= |fiba_ranking=10th [http://www.fiba.com/pages/eng/fc/even/rank/p/openNodeIDs/17814/selNodeID/17814/rankYouth.html FIBA Ranking for Youth national teams] |logo= |fiba_zone=FIBA Europe |national_fed=[[Spanish Basketball Federation|FEB]] |coach=[[Juan Antonio Orenga]] |world_championship=[[FIBA Under-19 World Championship|U-19 World Championships]] |wc_appearances=6 |wc_medals=[[Image:Gold medal icon.svg]] 1999
[[Image:Bronze medal icon.svg]] 1995 |zone_championship=''Other championships'' |zone_appearances=''no contest'' |h_pattern_b=_thinsidesonwhite|h_body=DD0000|h_shorts=DD0000|h_pattern_s=_blanksides2 |a_pattern_b=_thinyellowsides|a_body=DD0000|a_shorts=DD0000|a_pattern_s=_yellowsides }} The '''Spain national U-19 basketball team''' ''(Spain Youth national basketball team)'', is the representative for [[Spain]] in international [[basketball]] competitions, and it is organized and run by the [[Spanish Basketball Federation]]. The '''Spain national U-19 basketball team''' represents Spain at the [[FIBA Under-19 World Championship]]. ==FIBA Under-19 World Championship== {| class="wikitable" style="text-align: center;" |- !Year !width="100"|Position |- |{{flagicon|Brazil}} [[FIBA Under-19 World Championship 1979|1979]]||''not participated'' |- |style="border: 3px solid red"|{{flagicon|Spain}} [[FIBA Under-19 World Championship 1983|1983]]||4th |- |{{flagicon|Italy}} [[FIBA Under-19 World Championship 1987|1987]]||''not participated'' |- |{{flagicon|Canada}} [[FIBA Under-19 World Championship 1991|1991]]||6th |-bgcolor=cc9966 |{{flagicon|Greece}} [[FIBA Under-19 World Championship 1995|1995]]||[[Image:Bronze medal icon.svg]] |-bgcolor=gold |{{flagicon|Portugal}} [[FIBA Under-19 World Championship 1999|1999]]||[[Image:Gold medal icon.svg]] |- |{{flagicon|Greece}} [[FIBA Under-19 World Championship 2003|2003]]||''not participated'' |- |{{flagicon|Serbia}} [[FIBA Under-19 World Championship 2007|2007]]||8th |- |{{flagicon|Australia}} [[FIBA Under-19 World Championship 2009|2009]]||10th |- |{{flagicon|Latvia}} [[FIBA Under-19 World Championship 2011|2011]]||''not participated'' |- |'''Total'''||'''6/10''' |} ==References== {{reflist}} ==See also== *[[Spanish Basketball Federation]] *[[Spain national youth basketball teams]] {{International youth basketball}} {{Basketball in Spain}} [[Category:Spain national basketball team|U-19]]
